title: Yukon
summary: "The Yukon is a giant mining platform which can efficiently strip mine entire asteroid fields."
full_text:
Yukon
"The Yukon is a giant mining platform which can efficiently strip mine entire asteroid fields."
The Yukon is a miner-class ship of the Everest ship line. It is best suited as an expensive but powerful miner, boasting the highest mining rates in the game.
Advantages
The Yukon has more health and more rig slots than the lighter ships in its line, the Ozark and Kodiak. It also has more PDT slots, as well as some small-turret slots on its underside, allowing for better self-defense ability against weak enemies.
The addition of two cargo slots allows it to store more ore and stay in wild for longer.
The Yukon has a +125% mining speed bonus, compared to Ozark's and Kodiak's +100%.
Disadvantages
As a heavy destroyer-miner, it has very poor mobility.
Although it can equip combat turrets, it's not a combat ship and has fewer hitpoints than combat destroyers, as well as a non-ideal turret placement. Do not use the Yukon as a combat ship.
It is very expensive and requires more resources to craft than other destroyers.
Trivia
The current Yukon is modeled by Drezzlez.
There's a hidden 20% damage debuff on the Yukon. This can be seen in the Yukon's stats in the Test Server.
Due to its mining turret limitations, pilots can equip 4 combat turrets on the Yukon without sacrificing any mining capability.
